page.title: 12Recreation-Leisure Centre.
page.content: The Leisure Centre was opened in 1915 to serve the community as a Public Hall and Library. It was also a cinema until 1982, when it was converted into a building for entertainment, recreation and indoor games. The library is still there and it is well attended on Tuesday and Friday nights when it is open. The Centre is now used by a flourishing and enthusiastic Badminton Club, and also by a Karate Club. The multi-purpose building also acts as a Theatre for Drama productions, Concerts and Pantomimes regularly throughout the year. Every third Saturday in September the local Eisteddfod is held there and it has a strong local following. One of the rooms in the Centre is used as a Council Chamber by the Llannon Community Council.
